decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful artifacts and devastating threats. By ramping up and assembling the UrzaTron lands, it can quickly cast game-changing spells like All Is Dust and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms. Tezzeret, Cruel Captain and Karn, the Great Creator also provide versatile options to disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck is designed to outvalue opponents with its powerful artifacts and Eldrazi threats, creating a strong board presence while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on playing aggressively with a mix of creatures and spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing a combination of powerful creatures like Scion of Draco, Territorial Kavu, Ragavan, Nimble Pilferer, and Leyline of the Guildpact, along with efficient removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Stubborn Denial, the deck aims to apply early pressure and maintain board control throughout the game. Consign to Memory and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker provide additional versatility and ways to disrupt the opponent's strategy.

This Boros Aggro deck focuses on fast and aggressive strategies, utilizing powerful creatures like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Guide of Souls to quickly overwhelm opponents. Support cards like Ajani, Nacatl Pariah and Goblin Bombardment help maintain pressure on the opponent while control elements like Static Prison and Arena of Glory disrupt their game plan. With a mix of efficient creatures, removal spells, and disruptive elements, this deck aims to win through quick and consistent damage output while being able to adapt to different matchups.

This UW Control deck focuses on using a variety of counterspells and removal spells to control the board while generating card advantage and creating tempo swings with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Ephemerate. The deck also utilizes unique cards like Consult the Star Charts and Tune the Narrative to manipulate the game in its favor. With a mix of removal, counterspells, card draw, and tempo plays, this deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan and establish control of the game until it can win with its threats or lock the opponent out of the game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Allosaurus Rider to generate mana and then utilizing various cards to quickly assemble and execute a powerful combo. This combo involves tutoring for key pieces, creating mana, generating card advantage, and ultimately summoning powerful creatures like Griselbrand, Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier to overwhelm the opponent. The deck aims to quickly build a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful creatures and combo potential. It utilizes a mix of ramp, card draw, and tutor effects to execute its game plan effectively.

The deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with cards like Utopia Sprawl and Talisman of Impulse to play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End and World Breaker. It also includes control elements like Karn, the Great Creator and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with massive threats and inevitability, out-valuing them in the late game with Eldrazi creatures and maintaining control of the board with various removal spells and disruptive effects.

The deck focuses on maximizing mana efficiency and card advantage through the use of cards like Coiling Oracle, Birthing Ritual, and Shardless Agent. It aims to maintain board presence and disrupt opponents with counter spells like Subtlety and Flare of Denial while also utilizing creatures like Ice-Fang Coatl and Harbinger of the Seas for tempo and control. The inclusion of Endurance and Abhorrent Oculus helps to deal with graveyard strategies and provide additional threats. Overall, the deck seeks to overwhelm opponents with a fast-paced, synergistic approach that combines aggression and disruption effectively.

This UW Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan through a mix of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude, along with counterspells like Counterspell and Spell Snare, the deck aims to control the board and protect its own life total. Ephemerate and Tune the Narrative provide additional card advantage, while Quantum Riddler and Subtlety offer versatile answers to a variety of threats. Teferi, Time Raveler helps to stall the opponent's game plan, while Consult the Star Charts digs for key cards.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana through rituals and medallions to cast powerful spells like Glimpse the Impossible and Ral, Monsoon Mage. The goal is to chain spells together using Past in Flames to generate a massive storm count for lethal damage. Valakut Awakening and Wrenn's Resolve provide card selection and draw to find combo pieces. The deck aims to win the game in a single explosive turn, overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells. Play carefully, managing resources well to set up the perfect storm.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures from the graveyard using spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. Atraxa and Fallaji Archaeologist help to enable this strategy, while cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize provide disruption and protection. The goal is to assemble the combo pieces needed to bring back creatures like Griselbrand or Priest of Fell Rites early in the game, overwhelming opponents with powerful threats. The deck also includes ways to interact with the opponent's board and disrupt their game plan, making it a versatile and flexible combo deck in the Modern format.

This deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. The goal is to control the game by using powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Ceaseless Hunger, while also disrupting the opponent with cards like All Is Dust and Warping Wail. Karn, the Great Creator can also be used to shut down opponent's artifacts and fetch specific artifacts from the sideboard. This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and disruption spells.

The deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board through removal spells and counterspells while using card advantage to maintain a strong position. It also aims to generate value through repeatable effects from cards like Snapcaster Mage and Consult the Star Charts. The win condition is to eventually overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats like Phlage, Titan of Fire's Fury and Thundertrap Trainer. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements and curve. Overall, the deck's goal is to maintain control of the game until it can secure a decisive victory.

The deck aims to control the game by using counterspells, removal, and powerful planeswalkers like Teferi, Time Raveler. It also uses creatures with value-generating abilities like Coiling Oracle and Eternal Witness to outvalue the opponent. The deck's synergy comes from cards like Ephemerate and Risen Reef, which provide card advantage and incremental value. The mana base is well-crafted to provide consistent and stable mana sources for the deck's color requirements. Ultimately, the deck seeks to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing its own strong board presence.

The deck focuses on using a variety of control elements such as counterspells, removal spells, and discard effects to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition. It combines powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Sheoldred's Edict with card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Consult the Star Charts to gain incremental advantages over time. The deck also has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent access to its spells and colors.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with aggressive creatures, known as Death and Taxes strategy. By using cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control your opponent's resources and Ephemerate to protect your creatures, you aim to outvalue your opponent and win through incremental advantage. Cards like Relic of Progenitus also help you disrupt graveyard strategies. The deck also includes powerful finishers like Emperor of Bones and Overlord of the Balemurk to close out games quickly.

This deck focuses on using instant spells like Ephemerate and Faithful Mending to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Emperor of Bones and Griselbrand from the graveyard. The strategy involves setting up the graveyard with cards like Fallaji Archaeologist and Goryo's Vengeance, while also controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Force of Negation. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending to deal with opponent threats. Overall, the goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game through powerful reanimation strategies.
